definition: nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Britain has a history of contagious rioting.
sentences.chinese: 倫敦蔓延性的暴亂具有悠久的歷史。

sentences.english: Analyzing the effect of failure modes to ductility of connection.
sentences.chinese: 分析了節點破壞模式對節點延性的影響。

sentences.english: They also have more tensile strength and less ductility.
sentences.chinese: 他們也有更多的抗拉強度和延性較低。

sentences.english: The ductility and dissipation of this kind of structure is better.
sentences.chinese: 這種結構有一定的延性和較好的耗能能力。

sentences.english: The seismic ductility of piers with confined concrete is analyzed. The restraint effect of c.
sentences.chinese: 並採用約束混凝土的概念分析了墩柱的抗震延性。

sentences.english: The change of the fracture pattern of UHPC from brittleness to toughness was also brought by fiber reinforcement.
sentences.chinese: 破壞形態從脆性斷裂轉變爲延性破壞。

sentences.english: Its micro-feature is appeared as the dimplefracture and seems to be of the ductile fracture mechanism.
sentences.chinese: 其微觀形態爲塑坑斷口，屬延性斷裂機制。
